verses.verse: And Hezekiah said to Isaiah, (Judg. 6:17, 37, 39; Is. 7:11, 14; 38:22) “What is the sign that the LORD will heal me, and that I shall go up to the house of the LORD the third day?”

Then Isaiah said, (Num. 23:19; Is. 38:7, 8) “This is the sign to you from the LORD, that the LORD will do the thing which He has spoken: shall the shadow go forward ten degrees or go backward ten degrees?”
And Hezekiah answered, “It is an easy thing for the shadow to go down ten degrees; no, but let the shadow go backward ten degrees.”
So Isaiah the prophet cried out to the LORD, and (Josh. 10:12-14; Is. 38:8) He brought the shadow ten degrees backward, by which it had gone down on the sundial of Ahaz.

(The Babylonian Envoys) (2 Kin. 8:8, 9; 2 Chr. 32:31; Is. 39:1-8) At that time Berodach-Baladan the son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a present to Hezekiah, for he heard that Hezekiah had been sick.

And (2 Kin. 16:9; 2 Chr. 32:27, 31) Hezekiah was attentive to them, and showed them all the house of his treasures—the silver and gold, the spices and precious ointment, and all his armory—all that was found among his treasures. There was nothing in his house or in all his dominion that Hezekiah did not show them.
Then Isaiah the prophet went to King Hezekiah, and said to him, “What did these men say, and from where did they come to you?” So Hezekiah said, “They came from a far country, from Babylon.”
And he said, “What have they seen in your house?” So Hezekiah answered, (2 Kin. 20:13) “They have seen all that is in my house; there is nothing among my treasures that I have not shown them.”
Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah, “Hear the word of the LORD:

‘Behold, the days are coming when all that is in your house, and what your fathers have accumulated until this day, (2 Kin. 24:13; 25:13-15; 2 Chr. 36:10; Jer. 27:21, 22; 52:17) shall be carried to Babylon; nothing shall be left,’ says the LORD.

‘And (2 Kin. 24:12; 2 Chr. 33:11) they shall take away some of your sons who will descend from you, whom you will beget; (Dan. 1:3-7) and they shall be (Dan. 1:11, 18) eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.’ ”
So Hezekiah said to Isaiah, (1 Sam. 3:18) “The word of the LORD which you have spoken is good!” For he said, “Will there not be peace and truth at least in my days?”

(Death of Hezekiah) (2 Chr. 32:32) Now the rest of the acts of Hezekiah—all his might, and how he (Neh. 3:16) made a (2 Kin. 18:17; Is. 7:3) pool and a tunnel and (2 Chr. 32:3, 30) brought water into the city—are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
So (2 Kin. 16:20; 2 Chr. 32:33) Hezekiah rested with his fathers. Then Manasseh his son reigned in his place.
(Manasseh Reigns in Judah) Manasseh (2 Chr. 33:1-9) was twelve years old when he became king, and he reigned fifty-five years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Hephzibah.
And he did evil in the sight of the LORD, (2 Kin. 16:3) according to the abominations of the nations whom the LORD had cast out before the children of Israel.

For he rebuilt the high places (2 Kin. 18:4, 22) which Hezekiah his father had destroyed; he raised up altars for Baal, and made a wooden image, (1 Kin. 16:31-33) as Ahab king of Israel had done; and he ((Deut. 4:19; 17:2-5); 2 Kin. 17:16; 23:5) worshiped all the host of heaven and served them.
(Jer. 7:30; 32:34) He also built altars in the house of the LORD, of which the LORD had said, (1 Kin. 11:13) “In Jerusalem I will put My name.”
And he built altars for all the host of heaven in the (1 Kin. 6:36; 7:12; 2 Kin. 23:12) two courts of the house of the LORD.

((Lev. 18:21; 20:2); 2 Kin. 16:3; 17:17) Also he made his son pass through the fire, practiced (Lev. 19:26, 31; (Deut. 18:10-14); 2 Kin. 17:17) soothsaying, used witchcraft, and consulted spiritists and mediums. He did much evil in the sight of the LORD, to provoke Him to anger.

He even set a carved image of Asherah that he had made, in the house of which the LORD had said to David and to Solomon his son, (2 Sam. 7:13; 1 Kin. 8:29; 9:3; 2 Kin. 23:27; 2 Chr. 7:12, 16; Jer. 32:34) “In this house and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, I will put My name forever;

(2 Sam. 7:10; (2 Kin. 18:11, 12)) and I will not make the feet of Israel wander anymore from the land which I gave their fathers—only if they are careful to do according to all that I have commanded them, and according to all the law that My servant Moses commanded them.”
But they paid no attention, and Manasseh ((Prov. 29:12)) seduced them to do more evil than the nations whom the LORD had destroyed before the children of Israel.
And the LORD spoke (2 Kin. 17:13) by His servants the prophets, saying,

(2 Kin. 23:26, 27; 24:3, 4) “Because Manasseh king of Judah has done these abominations ( (1 Kin. 21:26) he has acted more wickedly than all the (Gen. 15:16) Amorites who were before him, and (2 Kin. 21:9) has also made Judah sin with his idols),
therefore thus says the LORD God of Israel: ‘Behold, I am bringing such calamity upon Jerusalem and Judah, that whoever hears of it, both (1 Sam. 3:11; Jer. 19:3) his ears will tingle.
